website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a pretty kettle and one that you can put out on show, this is it. Heats up quickly and retains heat.
pros: Heats up in a flash because of special 3D bottom design
Shiny exterior of stainless steel makes it easy to clean
Nonslip silicone handle is comfortable on hands when preparing beverage
cons: Not suitable for an induction stove or cooktop
May sputter water on occasion before you open the spout to pour liquid into cup

customer_reviews.title: Love this well made kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Very excited about this kettle. Love that it has a lid so I can dry out inside it. Also, there was a review about how well it holds heat; it is true. I boiled water for tea. Poured more water an hour later, and water was still steaming! Then 2 hours later, water was still hot enough for me to use to boil eggs...water for eggs reached boiling point in less than 2 minutes! Also, the included tea infuser was so much better than one I bought in a tea shop; no particles leak out of this one. Extremely happy!!
customer_reviews.author: J Dub

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous kettle that’s easy to maintain , heats quickly and stays warm
customer_reviews.text: Super good looking kettle. Love the gentle whistle. Very easy to maintain and clean. Hot water stays warm longer in this kettle than any other we’ve owned. Only concern for someone with bad hands is that when full, it could be heavy. But otherwise the extra weight adds to it’s beautiful finish and superb efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: ... kettle for almost 2 weeks and so far I love it! It has a nice
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my new tea kettle for almost 2 weeks and so far I love it! It has a nice, flat bottom which works perfectly on my smooth, glass topped stove. The tea kettle is beautiful and well made. I look forward to many years of using this tea kettle!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: It's one of those quality items that you are glad you have for it's functionality and good looks
customer_reviews.text: Had the kettle for a couple of weeks now. Keep it on the wood stove and after it whistles, I put it on a trivet on the wood stove to keep it hot. It's one of those quality items that you are glad you have for it's functionality and good looks. The photo shows the kettle sitting on the metal trivet.
customer_reviews.author: Wilderness Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: I bought because of the reviews - Only used less ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought because of the reviews - Only used less than a week the main kettle where the spot is connected leaks after the kettle heats up. This is a major design flaw and buyers who need a daily kettle should perhaps look elsewhere. Quality is laking "Made in China". Very attractive however does not work for my daily tea and coffee needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: and functions well with regard to heat-resistant handle and easy one-hand pouring
customer_reviews.text: Esthetically lovely, clear and vocal whistle that one can hear from just about any part of the house, and functions well with regard to heat-resistant handle and easy one-hand pouring. I've searched for a tea kettle that would suit my needs and wants and this one meets all. Happy with my purchase and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jerzygrl

customer_reviews.title: The kettle is of heavy construction with a very comfortable handle. It seems to heat up so much ...
customer_reviews.text: Every so often you have a company that is just head and shoulders above the rest. This is that kind of company. A stellar product, a stellar company, and very fast shipping, what more could you ask. We will think fondly of you each morning, and on the cold winter nights. Oh, and incredible customer service! A must buy and we will be telling all of our friends. The kettle is of heavy construction with a very comfortable handle. It seems to heat up so much faster than past kettles and whistles loudly! We are so happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective, and also it's cheaper looking in reality than photos show
customer_reviews.text: So the little pin that holds the lever that lifts the spout lid broke the first time I picked it up. No joke- see pics. Don't risk wasting your money on this. Besides the defective pin, the otherwise pretty kettle is totally ruined by two giant visible Phillips head screws that hold the handle to the body of the kettle.
customer_reviews.author: mountaingoat87

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I read all the positive reviews and purchased this ...
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I read all the positive reviews and purchased this tea kettle. It is both durable and beautiful in appearance and practical in use. It is just as pictured too. I will proudly display it on top of my stove when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Squire

customer_reviews.title: Spout poorly designed, over-complicated nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Water boils quickly and the handle is easy to grip. Cons: If you attempt to lift the spout with the lever, the mechanical devise slips out and the spout closes and you can't open it again unless you grab it with your fingers. If you leave the spout attached to the lever, it doesn't close all the way and the kettle doesn't sing, it just boils and boils and boils. And then, if you try and pour it without lifting the spout so that it doesn't snap off and shut entirely, the water spews everywhere. Honestly the worst tea kettle I have ever had the misfortune to pay for, and I am planning on returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Paid almost twice for a kettle from Crate & Barrel. This is SO much better!!
customer_reviews.text: I paid over $80 for a kettle at Crate & Barrel and it is not even close to how great this kettle is for half the price!!! Extremely satisified!! We use a French Press for our coffee daily. We made the right choice getting this whisteling kettle! If you are contemplating about this kettle, don't! We did not receive any discount for posting this review. Truly a satisfied customer. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Widdershins

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but not functional
customer_reviews.text: Have to be very careful to hold on correct part of handle. Even then entire handle including insulated part gets hot. Looks nice but not functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE.  Going back to REVERE style  immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I HATE this: WHERE TO START? It’s a contraption: 1. The finger-latch to pour is dangerous exercise in futility...can barely pull without arching your wrist upward and sideways and stretching your finger upward; 2. Water trickles out or at full pour steam blasts your hand; 2. Lid is a huge struggle, easier not to put it on except then hotter steam blasts hand and arm; Black handle gets too hot; 3. Too heavy on wrist to manœuvre all parts at once; 4. Does it really whistle? Yes, if you stand right next to it waiting you can hear it! 5. Is it pretty? Yes. You can have mine, anybody want it? Pay the extra and get REVERE.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLOTTE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice with some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Kettle looks very nice but very large bottom makes pouring out the water very difficult, you have to tilt it over past 90 degrees to get the water out. It boils the water very quickly, however, and whistles very loud, which I like. Has a very large capacity and the mechanism works very well. The insulated handle is very comfortable and does not absorb any heat. The finish stays shiny and it is obviously high quality stainless steel. would not recommend to someone elderly that has a weak arm for pouring. Lid stays tight and secure, but is hard to remove to refill.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lamadrid

customer_reviews.title: I've had this tea kettle for some time. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tea kettle for some time. The first time I used it, I realized how hot the handle would get, so, I use a towel when I pour. Now though, it is leaking when I pour. The leak seems to come from where the spout meets the tea kettle. I dealt with the hot handle, but there is no fix on my end, for the leaking. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (4/13): The seller contacted me apologized and made everything right. *********** I should have heeded to the critical reviews. I received the tea kettle and at first look it appears really beautiful and all. However, after the honeymoon faze was over I noticed that it has marks and rust spots that should NOT be on something that is supposed to be "BRAND NEW'. I am glad that I had the kettle sent to me first before sending it to my niece as a home warming gift. I am giving it 2 stars because it LOOKS nice if you were going to use it for decoration only.
customer_reviews.author: Draye

customer_reviews.title: nothing better than surgical steel
customer_reviews.text: As a surgeon I appreciate good surgical stainless steel. This kettle is well built and beautiful at the same time. The bottom plate is thick and sturdy optimizing the rapid heating of the water. The whistle is loud enough without being obnoxious. This operation was a success.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice well made kettle
customer_reviews.text: Nice tea kettle. It's fairly heavy, attractive and has a mirror finish. seems to be well made with a heat proof handle. This was a gift for my daughter and she's been using it daily for a couple months and she still loves it. No instructions came with the separate little basket for loose tea but maybe most people already know what to do with those lol
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Cannot hardly hear the whistle!
customer_reviews.text: It makes more noise when heating water than my old cheap kettle and the whistle is not loud enough. So it had two things to do and that does both of them poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 10 months old & starting to rust inside!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kettle in Aug 2018. I don't use it often but enjoy a cup of tea every now & then. So when I went to put water in it today for tea I was shocked to see what looks like rust developing around the lower rim inside! I rinsed it out and took a paper towel to dry the area in question and sure enough there is rust. Like I've said before, it's not used every day but when I have used it I never leave water sit inside. I empty it and open the top so it would air dry. I'm very disappointed....10 months old and it's clearly not safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne  B

customer_reviews.title: Inside Rusted very first time I used it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this 5 stars, but I only used it once and it had all rust spots in it, even though I left no water standing in it! A well made tea kettle shouldn't rust, and certainly not on the very first time. I am very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J Pierro

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money.  It rusts.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and received this kettle on Oct 18. Looked durable and nice. However, after a month of using, I started to realize that the edges of the cover were rusting. I went back to double check the product description to make sure that it was made out of Stainless Steel. It was, but why did it rust after using it for 4 weeks. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: ALVCE

customer_reviews.title: Tea's on!
customer_reviews.text: Came very quickly and was out of the box, washed and whistling shortly after it was left by the mail lady. I like the mechanism that opens the pour spout. It seems very substantial and well made. That means to me that it should last a long time and that's something that makes me feel good about the pot, and the pot also looks very nice sitting on the stove. It's not gimmicky looking and that's also attractive to me. Practical styling and rugged and whistles nice and loud so I can hear it from the livingroom. I'm happy with the purchase and recommend it as a good quality pot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous faulty spout be careful
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy teapot. But for thd price tag I expect it to work corrextly and my lid for the spout does not work correctly. Water spills out at different angles. Burn hazard for sure. If this wasnt the case id give it 5 stars because the build quality seems good. Hard to rrally clean though as water likes to stay in it because of the design. Really hooed it would be worth thr price but with that horrible spout and lid I cant reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: xLeeGenDx

customer_reviews.title: No spiders can get in
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome. I say buy it. Much better than any electric kettle which hogs up counter space. Also it is completely stainless steal so there is no plastic in contact with your water, good luck finding that with an electric kettle. ( yes, I try to avoid plastic water bottles too) What’s more it’s much better looking too. And it comes with an great infuser. It whistles to alert you. It seals tight so you won’t find any spiders floating in your water, like I did in my electric kettle. Did I mention that it beats any electric kettle on the market. Oh And I got this to replace my electric kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Scu2r

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it.... inside of the kettle leeches particles into your water!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very pleased with this product. Over the last few weeks though I've noticed that there are floaty's inside the kettle..something is falling off inside and making its way into the water. Disgusting! I have cleaned and washed the cattle several times. So this is not built up Waste--this is something that's coming off the inside of the kettly- maybe its adhesive or rust .....Who knows how unhealthy this is. Update: I was given a new one to try again but the same leeching issue occurred. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jolynn Oblak

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, poor function
customer_reviews.text: Dispensing lever does not lock in place. So, one must continue to hold the whole time of pouring. Also, since the spout cannot be propped open, this means that one cannot leave the tea kettle to simmer unless one does not mind the continuing whistle of the spout cover. Wide base means tea kettle must be tipped very high to empty contents. When tipping to empty bottom contents, we had to use two hands and the back hand was burned on the handle because the insulated handle cover does not extend the full range of the handle. Also, the width and thickness of the conductive base make the kettle quite heavy for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Swell

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: This tea kettle is beautifully designed and has a wide bottom (10" more or less) which is a big reason I bought it. This replaces an old kettle which had a plastic spout covering, which melted on my gas stove top. This kettle is surprisingly heavy and substantial. Water heats up quickly. And, there are no plastic pieces that are potentially exposed to the flames. The only downside is the spout doesn't open up wide enough to make it easy to fill under a faucet. It's doable just not as easy. Also, the knob to open up the top is very easy to use. You put your finger/hand underneath the knob and it pops right open.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think...!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this kettle 5 times. Every time I use it within seconds of turning the burning on it starts making loud crackling/chirping sounds (some are high pitched) from the bottom plate. I mean really loud. It's louder than the whistle. I can hear it from other rooms in the house. I look forward to making coffee in the morning. My expectation is that all I should hear when I turn on the kettle is the soft sound produced by the burning. I like my mornings quiet and peaceful. I am going to need to return this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Rolls

customer_reviews.title: Whistle ?
customer_reviews.text: Very hefty and shiny. Tried a few times , need to find correct volume . Too low of water volume and it doesnt whistle . Too high and it immediately spits and boils over onto stove creating mess . There wasnt any indicator to water volume on the kettle or any papers either . Looks beautiful and shiny and built hefty . Otherwise would have been 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: this pot "whispers"
customer_reviews.text: beautiful pot but does not whistle! i have purchased cheap ones, expensive ones but i have yet to find a whistling pot that whistles! other than that, it heats water, you "kinda" don't need something to grab it with. depends on how you grab it. great weight. mechanically all is good but NOT why i bought it! will probably keep it. tired or returning generic products that don't perform as described. not worth the stress!
customer_reviews.author: totally at peace

customer_reviews.title: Great looking kettle but.....
customer_reviews.text: A greast looking kettle and with its thick base heats up quickly. However as with most people we fill the kettle through the spout unfortunately the whistle cap doesn't open fully enough to allow easy filling. One has to tilt the kettle at quite an angle to get the water to flow in through the spout. Please don't comment about taking the lid off and filling through that hole becasue if you want to top up and already boiled kettle the last thing you want to do is take off the lid. One needs to avoid being scolded!!!
customer_reviews.author: R Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Its a good kettle but the handle should have had a bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a good kettle but the handle should have had a bigger handle so u can pour water in it from different angles it does have restrictions... It doesn't rust thank God for that.. and the whistle should have had a lock to keep it from staying down when its hot so u can shut the whistle up instead u have to place it on a cooler non using burner or a cool place to place it.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzmgwatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tea Kettle for Induction Stove
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this tea kettle. I just put in a new induction range and needed to switch my tea kettle to something that would work with my new stove. I got this a couple of days ago and I am loving it. It boils extremely fast on the induction (about a minute) and I love the whistle! The tea kettle is a little heavier that what I thought it would be, but I think that's not a bad thing. It's definitely sturdy and I can't imagine how this won't last me for years and years. It's a beautiful kettle and is very easy to wipe clean. I'm so glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: QueenB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for over a year and used it multiple times daily for tea, usually reheating on and off throughout the day. This teapot has held up great. I did only use it for water, but there are not rust spots. The bottom is a bit discolored, but for how much use this was getting on high heat over time that is probably normal. The only issue is the little thumb pad that you press to pour slips off now. You can slip it right back on, but that might be an issue for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Eph

customer_reviews.title: Does not whistle
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first one because the cap that covers the pour spout did not seal so only spewed steam - received my replacement today and it seals but does not whistle - only hisses which can only be heard if you are near the pot. Not going to go through the tedious return process again - just chalking this up as a total loss. Dont buy if you are looking for a tea pot that actually whistles -
customer_reviews.author: Hector L. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: More Delicate than it Appears
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle while it lasted. I’ve had this one almost exactly a year and I’m done with its wear and tear quirks. I’d hoped that at this price point, it’d be durable, but this was my experience instead: The silicone cover for ‘spout lid lifter trigger” gets loose when it gets warm, sliding off easily, so it finally fell off and got lost. The mechanism that lifts the spout lid also slides out of its connection when you open it all the way and that’s a real challenge to put back together, especially when it’s hot and ready to pour- which it usually is when it breaks. Either way, I’m shopping for a new kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Whistling Kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle! I reviewed alot of whistling kettles on Amazon, but this one really caught my attention. I've used it over a dozen times since it arrived approximately 2 weeks ago. Very well made,handle does not get hot and its easy for me to hold and pour ,with my arthritis hands and thumbs. Nice whistle. Very good quality. I would high recommend this kettle.\ I have used this kettle many many times already. Really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Why doesn't it whistle?!?
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous kettle!! But why doesn't it REALLY whistle?!!? I didn't fill it past the fill line. Water was under that marker and it's just a faint noise that sounds like it could be a whistle.. nothing like the whistle I had on my previous kettle. You can't hear it from the next room. You can barely hear it in the same room. And I am in my 30's with no hearing issues.. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Defective from the start
customer_reviews.text: I was quite disappointed. My 1st concern was the rust,so I emailed to ask if had been approved. I think I recieved an AI response, cause it didnt answer my question. Now received the kettle in hope to start using it, unfortunately the connection to the spout opening broke with 1st use. . Returning it back. Had it only 15 minutes. After looking at how its made, I realize this wont last long and dont want to waste my time
customer_reviews.author: Gag gift

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle
customer_reviews.text: I have had this kettle for a few weeks now. We use it every day. I like the wide base - it's really solid and gives lots of surface area contact with the stove so the water heats up quickly. The handle is still comfortable to grab onto when the kettle is hot and the handle is connected to the kettle with screws so it feels really solid. The mechanism to open the spout also feels really solid. No complaints at all. We're really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rubysue

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, wide base, ideal for gas stove tops
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a water boil kettle that was large enough at the base to cover the gas flame of the stovetop, and it is, so I'm very happy on that point. Additionally, it's just beautiful, very well made and has a pleasant whistle when the water is ready for you. As for a negative, I can't really think of any, except that it's heavier than some, because it is well made, and the wide base, which I wanted, may not be best for every situation.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandranna

customer_reviews.title: I love this kettle :)
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking solid kettle. The whistle is not ear splitting but gets your attention. The handle stays cool, water boils quickly and I love the nice addition of a free tea steeper. Customer service is great too - they communicated with me right after my purchase so I know should I have any issues there will be someone on the other end to deal it. I have a feeling this kettle is going to hold up for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Smackie

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE-REPLACED WITH NO HASSLES
customer_reviews.text: Right from the first use, it leaks badly at the front of the center seam. I do not mean just a few drops beading on the pot, but a steady stream whereby a puddle forms. Poor construction? Poor quality control? Very disappointing! UPDATE: A VERY GOOD REPLACEMENT SENT WITHOUT DELAY and WITHOUT HASSLES. The Seller saw my poor review/complaint on here and sent a replacement with no hassles, they did not even require return of the original. The replacement is very good. Changed rating to 5*
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Quintero

customer_reviews.title: WHISTLE DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, there is a gap between the spout and whistle and thus it does not whistle had to return. Otherwise it heated well and was quite nice looking. Not willing to take a chance on a replacement as I just went through this with another tea kettle! UGH!
customer_reviews.author: purplegirl029

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great tea kettle. It's stunning to look at and easy to use (not that a tea kettle usually presents an intellectual challenge, but this one just works really well). Love the esthetic. My favorite characteristic is the weight. This is a substantial tea kettle. Not a wrist breaker but also not a cheap, lightweight piece of junk, either. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amester17

customer_reviews.title: A++++
customer_reviews.text: Great Tea Kettle.....worth every penny.....it is well built ..I honestly believe the only why you could hurt it is to burn it....but that would be hard to do with the loud whistle which is great for me as I'm hearing impaired. The company Willow and Everett gives wonderful personal services ...hard to find in this day and age....I would buy again from them in a heartbeat:)
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: ... buy this tea kettle because it got so many wonderful reviews. It is a beautiful looking kettle
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this tea kettle because it got so many wonderful reviews. It is a beautiful looking kettle, heavy, as described and seems of good quality. However the first time we used it the whistle didn't work. I had to nudge it to get it to whistle-----not good! It isn't a loud whistle either so wouldn't be heard from other rooms-----which is important to us. Also found it VERY awkward to pour. The spout and handle/trigger don't seem lined up correctly, making the pour uncomfortable. We are returning it. I would definitely NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaymen

customer_reviews.title: Rust!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy! After a coyple weeks alrwady has rust spots in bottom.
customer_reviews.author: kyc

customer_reviews.title: Whistle way too quiet
customer_reviews.text: The whistle wasn't loud at all. Have a really small tea pot without a whistle that I can hear while I'm in the same room. This one was just a little louder than that. Wanted something like my parents had when I was a kid that would whistle loud enough to hear down the hall into the bedroom. This wasn't even close. Returned it. They did promptly accept my return tho so that's why I gave 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marchus

customer_reviews.title: Getting closer to design I'm looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still looking for the right gas top kettle. This one hits most of the marks. 6 month durability seems okay. Fast boiling. No leaks. Weak areas are the whistle which sputters rather than whistles and is not audible in the next room. The black rubber on the trigger slides off as you pull it and does not open the spigot far enough for easy refill via that opening. Finally the lid is difficult to pull off for refilling that way.
customer_reviews.author: Cm

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed but am still hopeful...VERY Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this kettle, looks pretty and it works as described, but it has developed a leak at the base of the pour spout after five weeks of use. I wish I didn't have to write this review but rather had the ability to resolve the issue directly with the sellers but that button is not available, probably because the return window closed a few days ago. UPDATE: The company - Willow & Everett responded very professionally and promptly replaced our whistling kettle. It was delivered ahead of schedule and performs beautifully. We look forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: P & R

customer_reviews.title: Burned my hand :/
customer_reviews.text: It’s so beautiful and does what it’s supposed to. Boils water like a champ and I love the whistle. One star off because I didn’t realize that the lid needs to be pushed in pretty well otherwise it falls off when you pour out the hot water and then you get steam burns on your hand. It’s not exactly the kettle’s fault but my hand hurts and I think this makes us even.
customer_reviews.author: mash

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This kettle really exceeded our expectations. The larger size and capacity suits our needs perfectly, especially with colder weather and holidays upon us. Love putting the kettle, whether for tea, hot cider or hot chocolate and this kettle truly makes that an enjoyable experience. The sandwiched bottom allows the kettle to heat very quickly and keep contents warm for quite a while. The handle, flip top opening and whistle are impressively sturdy, making this the nicest kettle we've owned in over 40 years. Thanks so much Willow & Everett!
customer_reviews.author: TLS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: the handle is hot regardless of the synthetic coating. Likes: it has weight; if you have Rheumatoid or nerve issues in your hands this might not work for you. I also like the wide mouth spout (it will pour) Neutrality: I would like the whistle louder than what it is. It is worth the money so far!! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I like that I don't have to empty kettle with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't have to empty kettle with a hot-pad, the handle is warm but not hot. I also like the "feel" of this kettle. The weight is indicative of quality which others that I looked at lacked. The loud whistle of this kettle is also helpful when I am in the other room or otherwise engaged. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase and I would certainly buy again, although I doubt I will ever need to. A huge step above the quality available in my local stores.
customer_reviews.author: old school

customer_reviews.title: Good value, and one unique positive feature.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking kettle, with nice design and quality stainless parts. I was looking for a 'fast heating" kettle. I like William Sonoma's "rapid boil" model, but didn't want to pay >$200 to boil water. This kettle fast boils on my gas range, and at a fraction of the price. The shape of this kettle is much wider than a typical kettle. That allows the entire kettle to completely cover the large gas burner on my range, resulting in less heat loss, and a noticeably faster boil. I don't know if that feature is "by design" or just serendipity, but it works. My new favorite kettle
customer_reviews.author: NorthCountry Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, well made, highly polished teapot. Works as planned.
customer_reviews.text: This is a gorgeous tea kettle. It whistles perfectly, even when I overfill it. I DO overfill it often, because I like to make a lot of tea when I go to the trouble, making herbal tea I then heat in the microwave later - in a huge blue poreclain tea pot I bought on line as well. My only wish is that it had just a slightly larger capacity for this reason. I usually end up filling it again to top off that 12- cup teapot I mentioned. But that is my special case. This is a really beautiful tea kettle, made lovingly, highly polished, and it could not look more elegant.
customer_reviews.author: R. Corff

customer_reviews.title: Great tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: Great tea kettle. The whistle works great and the water heats quickly due to the large base. The only thing I wish would have been different which would make it perfect in my opinion would be if the handle would have bent over to the side. I wish I could bend the handle over when I want to take the lid off of the kettle to put my tea bag inside but it's not that big of a deal that it doesn't. Still happy I got it. I gave it four stars because the handle doesn't move out of the way and that's the only reason it didn't get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Machellrs

customer_reviews.title: Kettle will Outlive Buyer
customer_reviews.text: The kettle is beautiful and works extremely well. However, would you believe it? My spouse and I are in our 80's, which means I am hard of hearing and he is physically weak. He has difficulty filling and lifting the kettle, while I cannot hear the whistle. So there is nothing wrong with the kettle. We are the problem. I guess we will have to settle for another kettle of lesser quality that is lighter and, like our current one, will probably rust. If we had been able to keep this kettle, it would surely outlive us. Also, Willow & Everett has been very helpful in my reluctant return of the kettle. Excellent company and excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann P. Etscovitz

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I really love this kettle. The stainless steel is a nice match for the appliances in my kitchen. I also like that it whistles without penetrating my eardrums like my old teapot. Another great feature is that when it's boiling it doesn't ever boil over the spout, another thing that annoyed me about my previous kettle.
customer_reviews.author: KTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Really nice kettle
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kettle. It is very stout and well made. The body of it is, I'm not sure of the gauge, but is nice and thick. It has a very solid feel. The handle and moving parts move nice and smoth, again with thick enough steel to give it a very solid feel. The only negative is is large. It is tall and wide at the bottom. I read the measurements and knew them before ordering but it occupies more space then expected.
customer_reviews.author: jerry d

customer_reviews.title: A quality kettle.
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this kettle at the present time. I have used it for a month now without any problems whatsoever. Heating is fantastic, even, and my tea is ready in minutes. The whistling effect is not super loud, but it is loud enough to get my attention in a different room. The top is solid, the handles are nice and ergonomic, and nothings gets too hot when I am handling it. The outside is easily wiped off, and seems of decent quality. I know a lot of these products are made in China, but this one is definitely a decent product with a good design.
customer_reviews.author: CrankTop Contributor: Rock Music

customer_reviews.title: DANGER TO HEALTH
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend Buying this kettle for long term!!!! It’s not cheap and it’s not good lasting material we got it mid February and it already got oxicated and we have only used water to boil and now we can’t use it Because that’s bad for your health !!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING THIS KETTLE because you will regret and if you do not notice those stains inside it can also be causing harm to you DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.author: yahaira

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT buy again nor would I recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Although this tea pot looks great, the design is not good. It's VERY heavy, has several places that steam will burn you, and rubber guard slips off. I'm sure I will toss it at some point as it's not easy or safe to use. It does whistle well, but that's the only positive thing I can say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Warlick

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Handle came apart and company after repeated attempts did not contact me. Had someone spot weld and hopefully the handle will stay together. Poor handle performance and lack of company's attention to return e-mails or phone calls about the tea kettle does not prompt why we should favor the made in America cause.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt D.

customer_reviews.title: RUST RUST RUST and terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: A Terrible product. Started to rust after only using for couple weeks. Called customer service many times no one ever picks up the call. Left several VM no one ever calls back
customer_reviews.author: MCC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tea kettle!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It looks so classy, I can't believe the price I got it at. I even use the infuser occasionally and it works like a charm too! This really feels sturdy with a solid weight and the whistle is nice and loud. The last teapot I had had a plastic whisler and was pretty weak. I needed something I could hear from the other room and this one does the trick for sure. I use this thing every day and it heats up FAST. No rusting or weirdness of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Mia bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be better quality for the price. I've only used it a handful of times and it's already discolored and all rusted around the bottom rim after only a few months. Overall pretty disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite a while looking for a new tea kettle and I am happy that I found this one. It has a good water capacity, heats water quickly and doesn’t whistle too loudly. This kettle seems well made and looks very nice sitting on my stove. It has a good weight to it, but it isn’t too heavy for me. Whenever I’m done using it, I let it cool off a bit and then take the cover off and dry out the inside. It gets used multiple times a day and so far I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Black and Metal pieces
customer_reviews.text: After thoroughly washing this kettle for the first time, I boiled water 3 times, filling it with new water every time. All the boiled water came out of the kettle with small pieces, some black and others metallic. Not going to drink this. Definitely will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine an year ago. Yesterday I threw it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine an year ago. Yesterday I threw it away, because we saw there was rust inside. Really disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Sa_Ni

customer_reviews.title: Whistles While You Work.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love?! Great sturdy kettle.A little heavier than most due to heat plate in bottom. Heats very quickly. Whistle is nice and loud. Use potholder mitt to remove top for water refill if still hot. Weight can deceive and make you think that there's more water inside than actually is , so be sure and check it as you use water. Good new is, It can tolerate being filled very high without sputtering through the whistle.
customer_reviews.author: LeaveThisSpaceBlank

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Teapot!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awesome teapot!! LOVE the surgical steel---no rusting worries. The whistle is the main thing I needed as I burned up a stainless steel skillet when I forgot about it when heating water for instant coffee. This whistle is NICE AND LOUD---can hear it wherever I am--so now I won't be damaging any more pans :) It took me a while to get the $$ together to buy this, but IT IS WELL WORTH IT. This is a winner---you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: FREQUENT BUYER

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle to use for boiling water for French press coffee. I wanted something beautiful that I could leave on my cooktop, as I wanted it to sit there all day ready to heat water at my whim. This kettle fulfills that need perfectly. I love the way it looks (even more beautiful in person than in photos), and I even like the whistle. I'd buy this all over again.
customer_reviews.author: A Dittmeier

customer_reviews.title: rust
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 2 years and really enjoyed it for a while. However, I noticed the inside has some staining and the inside all around the base has rusted over and is black. I tried cleaning and wiping but it always comes back. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: NPC

customer_reviews.title: Easy path to a good tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with it. It seems high quality and comfortable to use. The heavy and wide base keeps it steady on surfaces and feels good when moving it around. Whistle sound is loud but not too loud and pitch seems OK. I wish the spout was a little larger opening and that I could keep it held open in order to pour water into it.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: does not whistle
customer_reviews.text: disappointed that it is just a regular teapot when it is advertised to whistle. I bought it for this convenience so that I can be at my desk and hear when it is ready but it doesn't make a sound. Small opening that your hand will not fit through so it is difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Merrye Peregrino

customer_reviews.title: "Always on" whistle function
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a tea kettle I was very happy with, but if I had to go back to my old one I'd be sad about it now. The fit and finish is very good, and the whistle has been plenty loud. I appreciate that the whistle can't be turned off by lifting the kettle handle, as my old kettle did. This means I'll never let all the water boil away, as destroyed my last kettle. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David Cardenal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful tea kettle . I would give it 5 stars except for the fact, that the whistle is not consistent. Sometimes it whistles and sometimes it doesn't. I'm careful not to over fill it and I get the same problem. Other than that its a perfect size and looks beautiful on the stove top.
customer_reviews.author: GregP

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic Whistle
customer_reviews.text: This tea kettle seems to be made very well. I received it this afternoon and after a good washing made my first pot of hot water. The whistle is pathetic. I have a bad habit of leaving my pot of water while I do something else and wanted a good whistle to remind me. I could barely hear it while standing beside the stove! Not sure if I will keep this tea kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Teakettle!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of this large teakettle. It holds the perfect amount of water to boil for both my 32 oz travel mug of tea and my husband’s 32 Oz French coffee press. This kettle actually allows the water to boil faster than the pot we used to use. And the whistle is just fun.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Pot. Protect Your Hand.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good tea pot with a whistle and this is nearly perfect for me. It has a very wide and stable base and the whistle is plenty loud. The only problem I have has been the handle. It has a pad, but is placed right above the pot lid and gets very hot. I have to use a dish towel to protect my hand as I pour. I've snugged the lid down tight, but still need the dish towel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Want a hassle to get a care guide — buy this kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Almost a perfect pot with 2 exceptions, SNEAKY TRICK FOR PRODUCT: The top lid does not seal well, so some steam leaks from the lid; the pot has a nice trigger to hold open the cap, but it does not lock open — no big deal; QUITE OBNOXIOUS, the seller will not give you a care guide unless you send them your cell phone AND email — pathetic for this price!
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Whistling beauty!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tea kettle. The whistle is pleasant enough. Access is easy for refill or cleaning and the handle stayed comfortable to touch. This kettle holds a lot of water and keeps it hot for an extended time. It’s a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: John Smith Really

customer_reviews.title: Almost caused fire, spout leaks
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this tea kettle for my daughter, after I purchased same kettle For myself and being very happy with it. While visiting my daughter she told me that the bottom of the spout had always leaked. Sure enough, this morning while using the kettle, the water was dripping at an accelerated rate, causing flames to surround the base of the kettle. Good thing we were in the kitchen to quickly remove from flame. Although it is past the return date, (purchased April 2019) I am hoping you will replace this kettle. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Aesthetician

customer_reviews.title: This one’s a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: Overall love this kettle. The handle is such an added bonus. The only negative thing I have to say about it is that the shape of the kettle can make it hard to pour 100% of the water out unless you literally tilt the entire thing upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Valadez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, terrible teapot. Lots of fake reviews, clearly.
customer_reviews.text: Just terrible, must be lots of fake reviews. -Does not pour in a straight line (shoots out from sides of nozzle) -When boiling it shoots water out the sides of the nozzle (unless you boil less than a cup) -Strange unwieldy opener that gets very hot and does not fully open nozzle. -Looks terrible (like a fat, squashed muffin. Except muffins are tasty. This thing is crap) -Handle gets extremely hot, meaning you can't pick it up. And when you do, you'll just get boiling water everywhere except the desired mug. Do.Not.Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy weight teapot which keeps water warm.
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared for a much much heavier teapot. Keeps water warm however with the weight. I am still getting used to it having purchased a week ago. The lid needs to be fitted tightly and there will be a bit of steam which I am always worried will burn upon contact. Holds a lot of water; so good for a crowd. I am going to empty the water not used each time as others have expressed to keep the pot in good shape. Is very attractive on my stove and it seems to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reel

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great but showing signs of rust.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present for my wife. Shes wanted a nice kettle for a long time and I saw this had nigh marks from various sources. After only the second use (in a period of 2 days) I noticed some rusting on the inside. I was able to scrub it out but I know its going to come right back. I will give the kettle a while longer to see how things progress... Aside that major issue, its very nice, great weight, the handle doesnt get overly hot and it looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, leaked every time it boiled both out the spout and lid.
customer_reviews.author: guy clanton

customer_reviews.title: A really GREAT tea kettle!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tea kettle with excellent high quality construction. I encountered a very minor issue after a couple days use and contacted Willow & Everett to ask a question about the kettle. I received a very prompt reply informing me the kettle will be replaced and it was. AMAZING!!! Such a wonderful company with the best customer service. I read many positive reviews about customer service for this kettle before I purchased. I am so glad I purchased a product with such a high level of customer care and quality. This tea kettle has been my best purchase on Amazon and definitely with the price listed. Thank you Willow & Everett!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Needed a better tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: I ruined my wife's tea kettle and I knew I had better replace it with something better. Crossed my fingers and bought this kettle. HOME RUN. Wife loves it. High quality, well made, and looks great. I even think it heats up faster. If you need a tea kettle you need this tea kettle.
customer_reviews.author: galectric

customer_reviews.title: Make one with a loud whistle
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that the whistle is weak. The reason people buy whistling tea kettles instead of using their pots, is to have something that alerts them, even if they are in a different room or upstairs. The whistle should be loud enough for them to be alerted so that they don’t burn their kettle or their house. Today I left the house with the kettle still on. I didn’t even hear the whistle. I’m not deaf or hard of hearing. On returning the water had boiled out. I’m glad I didn’t have a long errand. My apartment would have burned down. What good is a whistling tea kettle that barely whistles. So it’s not efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila B

customer_reviews.title: A Teakettle with a mind of it's own...will I whistle this year?...maybe...maybe not.
customer_reviews.text: My teakettle looks nice and washes/dries well. It's bright and shiny and should last a very long time. The only issue that I have, is that I bought a Whistling Teakettle AND This one DOESN'T whistle. Not even a tiny amount, but it boils well and should last........Maybe after 10-20 years from now when my hearing decreases, it won't matter that this Whistling teakettle DOESN'T Whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shifrin

customer_reviews.title: Great great kettle
customer_reviews.text: Great great kettle!! Water heats up extremely quick and the whistle is nice and loud! Only issue is that it is a little hard to pour, you really have to tilt it all the way to empty it out which is sometimes annoying since you're dealing with very hot water and the kettle itself is extremely hot. It is a little difficult to dry on the inside as well but it really isn't annoying enough of an issue that I feel it isn't worthy because it IS an AMAZING kettle!
customer_reviews.author: b.adair

customer_reviews.title: Whistle didn't whistle
customer_reviews.text: The instructions, that came 2 days after the kettle came, by the way, said the whistle could not be turned off. That statement was off by 180 degrees: we found that the whistle could not be turned ON.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Gaskill

customer_reviews.title: Skip this.
customer_reviews.text: Excuse water out all over the place and the cool candle is not Cool - it’s hot Very light weight
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the handle getting hot, but very good kettle
customer_reviews.text: Product works extremely well for a gas stove. The wide bottom keeps the heat on the kettle. The handle gets extremely warm though, and makes it challenging to pour without burning you had or getting water on the counter. It is better than any we have had and so far no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This tea kettle worked good for a couple months but now it is very noisy the entire time it is heating up the water. It is also very heavy and it's difficult to tell if there is water in it or not. It also looks very dirty on the outside and is difficult to clean. But the spout works better than any other teapot I've had. Best customer service so if you are not satisfied, they will refund your money.
customer_reviews.author: Desdemona
